publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1035 Stuart McMillan: Jonathan Ross’s Comments—That the Parliament notes with concern the crass remarks by Jonathan Ross claiming that he is "worth 1,000 BBC journalists" at a time when the BBC is to make swingeing cuts to staff across the United Kingdom; notes that the quality of BBC reporting is a significant factor in the BBC’s worldwide reputation, and expresses its support for hard-working BBC journalists as opposed to overpaid allegedly hard-working presenters.

S3M-1035 Stuart McMillan: Jonathan Ross’s Comments—That the Parliament notes with concern the crass remarks by Jonathan Ross claiming that he is "worth 1,000 BBC journalists" at a time when the BBC is to make swingeing cuts to staff across the United Kingdom; notes that the quality of BBC reporting is a significant factor in the BBC’s worldwide reputation, and expresses its support for hard-working BBC journalists as opposed to overpaid allegedly hard-working presenters.
S3M-1035 Jonathan Ross’s Comments (lodged on 13 December 2007) Michael Matheson*
S3M-1035 Jonathan Ross’s Comments (lodged on 13 December 2007) Jamie Hepburn*
